intro: Neoroepera banksii, commonly known as the Banks' rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. It is well adapted to arid conditions and can tolerate periods of drought. Neoroepera banksii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
